heisigComment: * Keep to the etymology when using this kanji as a primitive: a single hand all by itself.
heisigStory: Any way you count them, there are either too many or too few fingers to see a good pictograph of a hand in this character. But that it is, and so you must.
koohiiStory1: This pictograph actually really works if you look at it as a hand with fingers spread and middle finger pointing down. see the very top stroke as the edge of a shirt cuff, and it will all come together.
koohiiStory2: A hand is useful for 千一(1001) things.
